xl-ddm-data.description: Generic Directory Service Scheduler Configuration Revision 1.0.0.0

task.name: GDS Lookup Reconciliation
task.description: Reconciles a Lookup Definition from the target system

string-param.helpText: The IT Resource used to establish the connection to the Directory Server
The name of the object to reconcile
Holds the timestamp when this task was last executed successfully
The operation to perform on the object to reconcile. Has to be either Refresh or Update
The value written to Lookup Group in case the operation on the object to reconcile is Refresh
The name of the LDAP attribute that has to be stored as the encoded value
The name of the LDAP attribute that has to be stored as the decoded value
Specifies the search base to retrieve entries from the target system
Specifies the scope of the search to retrieve objects from target system. Has to be either Object, OneLevel or SubTree
Specifies which filter criteria has to be applied to retrieve directory entries. Must be a valid LDAP search filter

boolean-param.helpText: Select the option Yes if the LDAP search has to be extended by the timestamp this job was last time executed successfully as a filter criteria; otherwise select option No
Select the option Yes if the data should only be gathered from the reconciliation source; otherwise select option No

number-param.helpText: Specifies that how many threads this task should create to distribute the workload
Specifies the size of a block read from the reconciliation source

string-param.helpText: Specifies the name of the Job that will be started by this Job on successfully completion

task.description: Reconciles countries from the target system

The name of the object to reconcile
The path to the descriptor which specifies the mapping between the incomming field names and the reconciliation fields of the object to reconcile

boolean-param.helpText: Select the option Yes if reconciliation events should be handled offline; otherwise select option No

Specifies the scope of the search to retrieve objects from target system. Has to be either Object, OneLevel or SubTree
Specifies which filter criteria has to be applied to retrieve directory entries. Must be a valid LDAP search filter

boolean-param.helpText: Select the option Yes if the LDAP search has to be extended by the timestamp this job was last time executed successfully as a filter criteria; otherwise select option No
Select the option Yes if the data should only be gathered from the reconciliation source; otherwise select option No

number-param.helpText: Specifies that how many threads this task should create to distribute the workload
Specifies the size of a block read from the reconciliation source

string-param.helpText: Specifies the name of the Job that will be started by this Job on successfully completion

task.name: GDS Domain Trusted Reconciliation
task.description: Reconciles localities from the target system

string-param.helpText: The IT Resource used to establish the connection to the Directory Server
The name of the object to reconcile
The path to the descriptor which specifies the mapping between the incomming field names and the reconciliation fields of the object to reconcile
Holds the timestamp when this task was last executed successfully

boolean-param.helpText: Select the option Yes if the hierarchy parent name should be derived from the distinguished name of the entry

string-param.helpText: The name of the default hierarchy parent name that should be assigned to a new created domain if the loaded hierarchy parent name cannot be resolved
The name of the default type that should be assigned to a new created domain
The name of the default status that should be assigned to a new created domain

boolean-param.helpText: Select the option Yes if reconciliation events should be handled offline; otherwise select option No

string-param.helpText: Specifies the search base to retrieve entries from the target system
Specifies the scope of the search to retrieve objects from target system. Has to be either Object, OneLevel or SubTree
Specifies which filter criteria has to be applied to retrieve directory entries. Must be a valid LDAP search filter
Specifies the name(s) of the attribute(s) to ensure that the results of the search performed is sorted by the LDAP server before being returned

boolean-param.helpText: Select the option Yes if the LDAP search has to be extended by the timestamp this job was last time executed successfully as a filter criteria; otherwise select option No
Select the option Yes if the data should only be gathered from the reconciliation source; otherwise select option No

number-param.helpText: Specifies that how many threads this task should create to distribute the workload
Specifies the size of a block read from the reconciliation source

string-param.helpText: Specifies the name of the Job that will be started by this Job on successfully completion

task.name: GDS Domain Trusted Delete Reconciliation
task.description: Reconciles deleted domains from the target system

string-param.helpText: The IT Resource used to establish the connection to the Directory Server
The name of the object to reconcile
The path to the descriptor which specifies the mapping between the incomming field names and the reconciliation fields of the object to reconcile
The operation to perform on the object to reconcile. Has to be either Deleted or Disabled
Holds the timestamp when this task was last executed successfully
The name of the organization serving as to root context of a organizational hierarchy that has to be validated

boolean-param.helpText: Select the option Yes if Organization Root has also be validated; otherwise select option No
Select the option Yes if reconciliation events should be handled offline; otherwise select option No

string-param.helpText: Specifies the search base to retrieve entries from the target system
Specifies the scope of the search to retrieve objects from target system. Has to be either Object, OneLevel or SubTree
Specifies which filter criteria has to be applied to retrieve directory entries. Must be a valid LDAP search filter

boolean-param.helpText: Select the option Yes if the data should only be gathered from the reconciliation source; otherwise select option No

number-param.helpText: Specifies that how many threads this task should create to distribute the workload
Specifies the size of a block read from the reconciliation source

string-param.helpText: Specifies the name of the Job that will be started by this Job on successfully completion

boolean-param.helpText: Select the option Yes if reconciliation events should be handled offline; otherwise select option No

number-param.helpText: Specifies that how many threads this task should create to distribute the workload
Specifies the size of a block read from the reconciliation source

string-param.helpText: Specifies the name of the Job that will be started by this Job on successfully completion
